alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 4:08AM PST until December 28 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy rain transitioning to snow Tuesday afternoon. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches, except 6 to 12 inches above 7000 feet, and 10 to 20 inches above 8000 feet. Wind gusts near 50 mph possible with 100+ mph along the Sierra ridgetops. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause tree and property damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels falling to 7000 feet by mid to late Tuesday afternoon and then to 5000 feet by daybreak on Wednesday. Heavy, wet Sierra cement character snow is expected.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time.
